conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: walls have height and thickness, rooms read as volumes, view is elevated/angled, and ceiling/roof is removed to expose interiors.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear 3D extrusion with readable wall corners and volumes; cutaway is clean. Minor simplification of some corner/edge details and openings reduces perfect geometric fidelity.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room zoning matches (3 bedrooms, central living/dining, kitchen/utility core, multiple toilets). However exterior deck/balconies shown in 2D are not clearly modeled, and several wall lengths/partition placements appear simplified, affecting proportional fidelity and exact adjacency at the top/right edges.

interior_elements.notes: Beds, living seating, dining table, kitchen counters, and some bathroom fixtures are present and generally in correct rooms. Some fixtures/furniture are simplified or missing (e.g., detailed bath layouts), and a few pieces have generic scaling.

visual_clarity.notes: Readable cutaway with consistent materials and no major mesh breakage. Lighting is adequate but somewhat flat; some openings (doors/windows) are not strongly distinguishable, reducing structural clarity.

detected_errors.description: Exterior deck/balcony spaces from the 2D plan are not clearly represented in the 3D model, reducing layout completeness at the perimeter.
Doors/windows are simplified; several openings are not clearly located or dimensioned relative to the 2D plan.
Bathroom/kitchen details are partially simplified; some fixture placement/detail does not fully reflect the 2D plan.
Rendering clarity is good but openings and some partitions blend visually, making precise verification harder.

summary: A valid, clean 3D cutaway conversion with strong volumetric walls and mostly faithful room layout, but with notable omissions/simplifications of balconies/deck and several openings/partition proportions.
